title: Highest salaries in Major League Baseball 2019
summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Baseball Player, and Salary in million U.S. dollars in each Baseball Player on the y axis.
The Salary in million U.S. dollars is highest at Baseball Player Stephen Strasburg and lowest at Baseball Player Jason Heyward.
The difference of Salary in million U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Baseball Player is 15.83.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Salary in million U.S. dollars for 20 number of Baseball Players.
The maximum Salary in million U.S. dollars 38.33 is found at Baseball Player Stephen Strasburg and the minimum is found at Jason Heyward where Baseball Player is 22.5.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Baseball Player, and Salary in million U.S. dollars in each Baseball Player on the y axis.

max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Baseball Player in the x axis and Salary in million U.S. dollars in the y axis.
Baseball Player Stephen Strasburg has the highest Salary in million U.S. dollars and Jason Heyward has the lowest Salary in million U.S. dollars.
The second highest Salary in million U.S. dollars is appeared to be the Baseball Player Max Scherzer.
There is a difference of 15.83 between the maximum Baseball Player Stephen Strasburg and minimum Baseball Player Jason Heyward.

Baseball Player Stephen Strasburg is higher than any other Baseball Players with value 38.33, followed by Max Scherzer, and Zack Greinke. Down to Baseball Player Jason Heyward with the lowest value 22.5.
Similar Salary in million U.S. dollars is found in Baseball Player Jake Arrieta, Jordan Zimmermann, and Joey Votto.
The average Salary in million U.S. dollars in all 20 Baseball Players is 28.14.
The Salary in million U.S. dollars is 562.85 if we add up values of all Baseball Players.
